official_title: RAndomized Phase II/III Trial of Consolidation Radiation + Immunotherapy for ES-SCLC: RAPTOR Trial
brief_title: Testing the Addition of Radiation Therapy to the Usual Immune Therapy Treatment (Atezolizumab) for Extensive Stage Small Cell Lung Cancer, The RAPTOR Trial
cancer_type_display: A study for patients with extensive stage small cell lung cancer who have responded to initial chemotherapy and immunotherapy.
cancer_tags: Extensive Stage Lung Small Cell Carcinoma
prior_treatments_required: 4-6 cycles of etoposide/platinum (E/P) doublet plus atezolizumab
prior_treatments_excluded: Prior radiotherapy in the thorax that would result in overlapping RT fields
Prior immunotherapy that resulted in pneumonitis
key_inclusion_summary: Confirmed diagnosis of extensive stage small cell lung cancer.
Must have achieved a partial response or stable disease after 4-6 cycles of etoposide/platinum chemotherapy plus atezolizumab.
Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status of 0-2.
Patients with treated, stable brain metastases are eligible.
key_exclusion_summary: Metastatic disease involving > 3 liver metastases, the heart, or > 10 total metastatic sites.
Active autoimmune disease requiring immunosuppressive treatment.
Prior radiotherapy to the thorax that would cause overlapping radiation fields.
